body.section:
jDTAUS Core provides a common application programming interface for jDTAUS integration. It comes split into various artifacts of different namespaces.
Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.common build the application programming interface. The Core artifact provides interfaces to core application services like task monitoring, data validation or modular implementation management.
Maven: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.common are the only artifacts allowed in the compile classpath when building applications. The Core artifact will almost ever be pulled in transitively as will other common artifacts.
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.common</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-core-api</artifactId> <scope>compile</scope> </dependency>
jDTAUS Core API site | JavaDoc.
Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.spi build the service programming interface. The Core artifact provides interfaces to be used by implementations to expose core application services to applications.
Maven: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.spi are needed in the compile classpath when building implementations but must not be in the compile classpath when building applications. Since implementation code depends on them during compile time they will almost ever be pulled in transitively via the application's runtime artifacts.
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.spi</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-core-spi</artifactId> <scope>compile</scope> </dependency>
jDTAUS Core SPI site | JavaDoc.
Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.runtime build the application runtime. These are standalone implementations implementing specifications from group org.jdtaus.common and providing core application services by using the service interfaces defined in group org.jdtaus.spi.
Maven: Artifacts of group org.jdtaus.runtime are never pulled in transitively. The application runtime needs to be assembled manually providing great integration flexibility. The Core artifacts are mandatory runtime artifacts.
The client container adapter provides the jDTAUS Container reference implementation and implements a runtime suitable for standalone, single-user client applications. The servlet container adapter extends that runtime for web applications.
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.runtime</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-client-adapter</artifactId> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>
and (optionally)
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.runtime</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-servlet-adapter</artifactId> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>
jDTAUS RI Client Adapter site | JavaDoc.
jDTAUS RI Servlet Adapter site | JavaDoc.
Note: Web applications must be configured manually to work correctly with jDTAUS. See ServletFilter.
Two logging implementations to choose from. JDK 1.4 or commons logging.
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.runtime</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-jdk-logging-adapter</artifactId> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>
or
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.runtime</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-commons-logging-adapter</artifactId> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>
jDTAUS RI JDK 1.4 Logging Adapter site | JavaDoc.
jDTAUS RI Commons Logging Adapter site | JavaDoc.
Two task monitoring implementations to choose from. The client monitor adapter implements a runtime suitable for client applications. The server monitor adapter implements a server runtime.
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.runtime</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-client-monitor-adapter</artifactId> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>
or
<dependency> <groupId>org.jdtaus.runtime</groupId> <artifactId>jdtaus-server-monitor-adapter</artifactId> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>
jDTAUS RI Client Monitor Adapter site | JavaDoc.
jDTAUS RI Server Monitor Adapter site | JavaDoc.
